pageContext.claim: “[In Iraq], we build runways that are 15,000 feet long. At LaGuardia they're 7,000 feet long. In fact, I think they're 20,000 feet long over there and deep thick concrete and steel.”
pageContext.analysis: The longest runway in Iraq is at Erbil International Airport at just over 15,000 feet long, and while the runway at LaGuardia is not longer, the runway at Denver International Airport is. Most runways in Iraq are close to 13,000 feet in length. That’s shorter than several runways at American airports.
